text: 17th-century depiction of Kunai Kunai-kyō (jp: 宮内卿) was a 13th century Japanese poet. A prominent poet during the Kamakura period, she is considered one of the Thirty-Six Female Immortals of Poetry.Rie Horii "Miyauchiro Kazuno Annotation Declaration - From" Mizunase Koiko Five Vocal Songs "" "Literary Study for Japanese Literature Women" 17, 33 - 49 September 30, 2004 Kazama Shobo == References == Category:13th-century Japanese poets
title: Kunai-kyō
